channel.title: Psalms on Christian Internet Resources
channel.description: Recent content in Psalms on Christian Internet Resources

item.title: Psalms 1
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 1

1 People are blessed that don’t

3 They’re like trees planted beside a river

4 Sinners aren’t like that:

6 The LORD watches over the godly,

item.title: Psalms 2
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 2

1 Why do the nations get together

2 Kings take their stand

3 Let’s break their bonds

4 The One that’s in heaven laughs;

5 He’ll speak to them in his anger

6 I’ve installed my King on Zion, my holy mountain.” Ps 2:1-6

7 I’ll tell the LORD’s decree:

8 Just ask me, and I’ll give you the nations to inherit,

9 You’ll rule them with an iron scepter

item.title: Psalms 3
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 3

1 LORD, I have so many enemies;

3 But you’re my shield, LORD, my glory,

4 When I call out to you,

5 I lie down to sleep and wake up again

6 I won’t be afraid if 10,000 oppose me.

7 Arise, LORD; rescue me.

8 Victory comes from you;

item.title: Psalms 4
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 4

1 Righteous God, answer when I call!

2 People, how long will you try to ruin my reputation?

3 Just remember that the LORD sets good people apart for himself;

4 If you’re angry, don’t sin;

5 Offer sacrifices with the right attitude

6 Many say, “Who will show us something good?”

7 You make me happier

8 I lie down to sleep in peace

item.title: Psalms 5
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 5

1 Listen to me, LORD;

2 Hear my call for help, my God and King,

3 You hear me in the mornings,

4 You’re not amused by sinfulness

5 Braggards can’t stand in your presence

6 You destroy liars

7 But I’ll go into your house under your enduring love

8 Because I have enemies, LORD,

9 You can’t believe a word they say;

10 Hold them guilty, God;

item.title: Psalms 6
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 6

1 Don’t lash out at me, LORD,

2 Be gracious to me because I’m weak;

3 I’m really scared;

4 Come back and rescue me;

6 I’m worn out from moaning;

7 My eyes melt from grief,

8 Go away, all you sinners,

9 He’s heard my plea

10 He’ll disgrace my enemies and greatly distress them;

item.title: Psalms 7
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 7

1 LORD my God, I’ve taken refuge in you;

3 LORD my God, if I’ve done wrong,

6 Rise up in anger, LORD,

7 Gather the nations around you

8 You that judge all people,

9 Put an end to people’s sinfulness;

10 You’re my shield who saves the godly in heart,

12 For someone that doesn’t repent,

14 Wicked people conceive evil,

15 They dig a pit and hollow it out,

item.title: Psalms 8
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 8

1 LORD, our Lord, you’re so majestic all over the world!

2 Out of the mouth of infants and nursing babies

3 When I look at the sky, the work of your fingers,

5 You’ve made us a little lower than the angels

6 You’ve given us responsibility over what you’ve made

9 LORD, our Lord, you’re so majestic all over the world!

item.title: Psalms 9
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 9

1 I’ll thank you, LORD, with all my heart

2 I’ll gladly celebrate over you

3 When my enemies retreated,

5 You’ve rebuked the nations,

6 Your enemies have ended up in permanent ruins;

7 But the LORD reigns as king forever,

8 He judges the world justly,

11 Sing praises to the LORD that lives in Zion;

12 He that avenges murder remembers the helpless;

13 Be gracious to me, LORD;

item.title: Psalms 10
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 10

1 Why stand so far away, LORD?

2 Sinners hunt down the poor in arrogance

3 They brag about their sinful desires;

4 In their arrogance, they don’t trust in him;

5 Yet they always seem to prosper;

7 They curse, deceive, and oppress;

8 They lie in ambush in villages,

9 They lurk in hiding places like lions in a den

10 They crouch and slink down;

item.title: Psalms 11
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 11

1 I rely on the LORD’s protection;

3 If the foundations of society collapse,

4 The LORD is in his holy Temple;

5 He tests the good and the bad

6 He’ll rain burning coals on sinners;

item.title: Psalms 12
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 12

1 Help, LORD; there aren’t any decent people left;

2 Neighbors lie to one another

3 May the LORD cut off their flattering lips

5 The LORD says, “Since the oppressed are suffering violence

6 Your promises are pure, LORD,

7 Keep us; protect us from this generation

item.title: Psalms 13
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 13

1 LORD, are you going to forget about me forever?

2 How long must I counsel myself in constant sorrow?

3 Think about me and respond to me, LORD my God;

5 I rely on your enduring love;

6 I’ll sing to you, LORD,

item.title: Psalms 14
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 14

1 Fools keep telling themselves there’s no God,

2 The LORD looks down from heaven

3 But they’ve all veered off course and become corrupted;

4 Don’t sinners realize what they’re doing

5 Terror will overwhelm them later

6 Oppressors try to frustrate the endeavors of the oppressed,

7 Oh that deliverance for Israel would come out of Zion!

item.title: Psalms 15
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 15

1 LORD, who can live in your Tabernacle?

2 Those who act with integrity,

item.title: Psalms 16
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 16

1 Protect me, LORD; you’re my refuge.

2 I say, “You’re my Lord;

3 The godly people on earth are the noble ones I delight in.

4 Trouble multiplies

5 The LORD is my permanent possession, my cup;

6 The boundary lines of my inheritance fall in good places;

7 I’ll bless the LORD that guides me;

8 I keep himY continually beside me,

9 So I’m happy and celebrate;

item.title: Psalms 17
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 17

1 LORD; listen to my call for justice;

2 Declare me innocent

3 You’ve visited me at night and tested my heart;

4 Your word has kept me from following

5 My steps have stayed on your path;

6 I’m calling on you, God,

7 Demonstrate your amazing, enduring love

8 Keep me as the pupil of your eye;

11 They’ve tracked me down and surrounded me,

item.title: Psalms 18
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 18

1 I love you, LORD, my strength,

3 I called on him who deserves praise,

4 The waves of death entangled me;

6 In my desperation, I cried out to the LORD,

7 Then the earth quaked and the mountains shook

8 Smoke poured out of his nostrils;

9 He lowered the sky too

10 He rode on a cherub

11 He covered himself with darkness like a pavilion,

item.title: Psalms 19
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 19

1 The heavens show God’s glory;

2 Day in and day out they speak;

3 There’s no speech or words;

4 Their testimony goes out to the whole world,

5 It’s like a groom coming out of his room,

6 It rises at one side of the sky

7 The Law of the LORD is perfect for reviving the soul;

8 The precepts of the LORD are right, bringing happiness;

item.title: Psalms 20
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 20

1 When trouble comes, may the LORD answer you!

2 May he send help from the sanctuary

3 May he remember your many meal offerings

4 May he grant you your heart’s desire

5 You’ll sing for joy over his deliverance

6 We know the LORD saves his anointed ones;

7 Some nations boast about chariots and horses,

8 Those nations will collapse and fall,

9 Give us victory, LORD, when we call. Ps 20:6-9

item.title: Psalms 21
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 21

1 LORD, the king delights in your strength;

2 You’ve given him his heart’s desire;

3 You met him with blessings

4 He asked you for life,

5 He has great honor because you delivered him

6 You make him blessed forever

7 The king trusts in the LORD;

8 You’ll discover all your enemies;

9 You’ll throw them into a blazing furnace in your anger;

11 Though they’ve devised a coup to harm you,

item.title: Psalms 22
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 22

1 My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?

2 I call out in the daytime, but you don’t answer;

3 Yet you’re holy,

4 Our ancestors trusted in you, and you delivered them.

5 They called out to you, and you saved them;

6 But I’m a worm, not a man;

7 Everybody that sees me makes fun of me;

8 Entrust yourself to the LORD; let him deliver you;

item.title: Psalms 23
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 23

1 The LORD is my shepherd;

2 He beds me down in green pasture

3 He refreshes me

4 Even though I walk through the darkest valley,

5 You set a table for me in front of my enemies;

6 Goodness and mercy will follow me all my life,

item.title: Psalms 24
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 24

1 The earth and everything in it belongs to the LORD,

2 He positioned land higher than seas,

3 Who can climb his mountain

4 People with clean hands and pure hearts,

5 They’ll receive a blessing from the LORD,

6 That’s the way it is for those who seek him out

7 Open up, gates;

8 Who is the glorious King?

9 Open up, gates;

10 Who is the glorious King?

item.title: Psalms 25
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 25

1 I hold my life up to you, LORD;

2 I trust you;

3 Nobody that waits for you will be discredited;

4 LORD, let me know your ways;

6 Remember your mercy and enduring love

7 Don’t keep in mind the sins I committed when I was young;

8 The LORD is good and just,

10 Everything he does comes from truth and enduring love

11 For your own honor,

item.title: Psalms 26
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 26

1 Declare me innocent, LORD,

2 Examine me, put me on trial,

3 I keep my eye on your unfailing love

4 I don’t sit with deceitful people

5 I detest the company of unreliable people

6 I’ll wash my hands to express my innocence

8 LORD, I love the Temple where you live,

9 Don’t carry off my soul with sinners,

11 But I maintain my integrity;

item.title: Psalms 27
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 27

1 The LORD is my light and salvation;

2 When bad people come to devour me,

3 Though an army attacks me, it won’t frighten me;

4 I ask the LORD for one thing—what I look for most:

5 When trouble comes, he’ll shelter conceal me;

6 I’ll hold up my head above my enemies;

7 Listen when I call out, LORD;

8 You said, “Seek me,”

item.title: Psalms 28
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 28

1 I’m calling out to you, LORD;

2 Help me when I plead for help,

3 Don’t drag me away with the wicked,

4 Pay them back according to their deeds,

5 Since they don’t appreciate

6 Bless the LORD for listening to my petition.

7 He’s my strength and shield;

8 He’s his people’s strength,

9 Save your people and bless your inheritance;

item.title: Psalms 29
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 29

1 Children of the mighty,

2 Honor him like he deserves;

3 The sound from the LORD carries out over the water;

4 His voice is loud and majestic

6 He makes Lebanon skip like a calf

7 The sound from the LORD flashes out lightning bolts

10 The LORD sits like a king above the flood,

11 He gives his people courage

item.title: Psalms 30
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 30

1 I’ll praise you, LORD, because you’ve rescued me;

2 I appealed to you for help, my God,

4 Sing praise to the LORD, his holy people;

6 In my good fortune, I said, “I’ll never be shaken.”

7 Your blessing, LORD, made me feel as stable as a mountain;

8 I called out to you in a petition:

9 What does my death accomplish if you let me go down to the Pit?

item.title: Psalms 31
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 31

1 I take refuge in you, LORD;

2 Listen to me, rescue me quickly;

3 You’re my rock and fortress;

4 Free me out of the trap people secretly laid for me

5 I’m entrusting my spirit to you;

6 I detest those who respect worthless idols;

7 I’ll be happy in your enduring love,

9 Be gracious to me in my distress, LORD;

11 Because I have so many enemies,

item.title: Psalms 32
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 32

1 How blessed they are whose sin God forgives,

3 When I didn’t acknowledge my sin,

5 When I acknowledged it and said, “I’ll confess my sin to the LORD,”

6 So everyone that’s godly needs to pray to you

7 You’re our hiding place

8 I’ll teach you the way to go;

9 Don’t be like a senseless horse or mule

10 Sinful people incur lots of sorrow,

item.title: Psalms 33
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 33

1 Sing for joy to the LORD, good people;

2 Give him thanks with a lyre;

3 Sing a new song to him;

4 You can believe what he says

5 He loves goodness and justice,

6 The LORD made the sky with a word,

7 He gathered the water in the ocean

8 The whole world must respect him

9 He spoke and it happened;

10 The LORD overrides the counsel of nations

item.title: Psalms 34
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 34

1 I’ll bless the LORD at all times

2 I’ll make my boast about him;

3 Let’s tell how great the LORD is;

4 I looked to the LORD; he answered me

5 People that look to him are radiant;

6 I cried out in my suffering, and he listened

7 An angel of the LORD camps around people that respect him,

8 Taste and find out how good the LORD is,

item.title: Psalms 35
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 35

1 LORD, oppose the ones that oppose me;

2 Put on buckler and shield,

3 Draw spear and javelin against my pursuers;

4 Dishonor the ones that want to kill me;

5 Make them like chaff in the wind,

6 Make their path dark and slippery,

8 Bring destruction on them unawares;

9 I’ll be happy in the LORD

10 My very bones say, “LORD, who is like you

item.title: Psalms 36
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 36

1 Sin speaks to sinful people’s hearts;

2 They flatter themselves

3 Their words deceive;

4 They devise schemes in bed

5 LORD, your enduring love reaches the stars;

7 How precious that enduring love is!

8 They drink their fill from the abundance in your house,

9 You’re their fountain of life;

10 Maintain your enduring love to all who know you,

11 Don’t let the proud tramp on me

item.title: Psalms 37
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 37

1 Don’t worry about bad people

3 Trust in the LORD and do good

4 Delight in the LORD,

5 Commit your way to him and trust him,

6 He’ll bring forth your goodness like the dawn

7 Rest in the LORD and wait patiently for him;

8 Stop being mad at them; set anger aside;

9 They’ll be destroyed,

10 Sinners will soon be gone;

11 It’s the humble that inherit the land

item.title: Psalms 38
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 38

1 LORD, don’t rebuke me in your wrath

2 Your arrows have pierced deep into me;

3 Because of your indignation, my body’s not sound;

4 My iniquities have piled up higher than my head

5 My wounds have festered and grown foul.

7 I’m burning up with fever;

8 I’m numb and crushed,

9 Lord, you know what I long for;

10 My heart’s pounding, my strength’s failing;

item.title: Psalms 39
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 39

1 I said, “I’ll watch what I do

2 But when I kept silent even about what was good,

3 The more I thought about it

4 LORD, show me my end,

5 You’ve made my days like handbreadths;

6 We walk around like shadows in turmoil for nothing;

7 Now Lord, what is it I’m waiting for?

8 Save me from my sins;

9 I can’t open my mouth; I’m not able to speak

item.title: Psalms 40
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 40

1 I waited patiently for the LORD;

2 He brought me up out of the pit of despair,

3 He put a new song in me, a song about praising God;

4 How blessed people are that trust in the LORD

5 LORD my God, you’ve done so many amazing things;

6 Your don’t delight in sacrifices and meal offerings;

7 Then I said, “I’m coming;

8 I delight in doing your will, my God;

item.title: Psalms 41
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 41

1 How blessed people are that have regard for the poor;

2 He’ll protect them, keep them alive, and call them blessed;

4 I said, “Be gracious to me, LORD;

5 My enemies say rude things about me:

6 When they come to visit me,

7 Everybody that hates me whispers behind my back

8 He has some deadly disease;

9 Even the close friend that I trusted, that I ate with,

item.title: Psalms 42
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 42

1 My soul pants for God

2 My soul is thirsty for the living God;

3 My tears have been my food day and night

4 I think about these things as I pour out my soul.

5 Why despair, my soul?

6 I’m in despair, God;

7 The sounds of your crashing waves echo back and forth;

8 The LORD directs his enduring love to me in the daytime;

item.title: Psalms 43
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 43

1 Declare me innocent, God;

2 You’re the God that I rely on for courage;

3 Send your light and truth to lead me,

4 Then I can go to your altar, my greatest source of joy,

5 Why despair, my soul?

item.title: Psalms 44
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 44

1 God, our ancestors have told us

2 You drove out nations and planted this one;

3 Our ancestors didn’t conquer the land with their sword;

4 You’re my King, God;

5 By your power we’ll push back our adversaries

6 We don’t trust in our bow;

7 You are the one that must save us from our enemies

8 We take pride in you always

9 Yet now you’ve set us aside to dishonor;

item.title: Psalms 45
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 45

1 My heart is overflowing with a noble theme

2 You’re more handsome than the sons of men;

3 Strap your sword to your thigh, Mighty Warrior,

4 In your majesty, ride on to victory,

5 Your sharp arrows pierce your enemies’ hearts;

6 Your throne is eternal, God;

7 You love goodness and hate sinfulness;

8 Your robes have the fragrance of myrrh, aloes, and cassia;

item.title: Psalms 46
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 46

1 God is our refuge and strength,

2 So we won’t be afraid

4 There’s a river of joy that flows into the city of God,

5 God is there; it’s unmovable;

6 When nations rage and kingdoms totter,

7 The LORD of Hosts is with us;

8 Come and look at what the LORD does:

10 So be still and know that I’m God;

11 The LORD of Hosts is with us;

item.title: Psalms 47
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 47

1 Clap your hands, everybody;

3 He subdued people groups under us,

5 God has ascended with a shout,

6 Sing praises to God, sing praises;

8 He reigns over the nations on his holy throne.

9 The rulers of the people have gathered together

item.title: Psalms 48
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 48

1 The LORD is great and deserves great praise

2 Mount Zion, the heights of Zaphon, is high and beautiful—

3 In its towers God reveals himself as a strong defense.

4 Kings joined forces

5 But as soon as it came into view,

6 Panic seized them

7 The LORD destroyed them

8 As we’ve heard, so we’ve seen

9 In your Temple we think about your enduring love.

item.title: Psalms 49
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 49

1 Hear this, every nation;

3 My words are wise;

4 I listen to proverbs

5 Why should I be afraid when there’s adversity,

7 Nobody can use wealth to redeem a brother from death

10 Even the wise die—

11 They act like their houses will last forever,

12 But in all their pomp, they won’t endure;

13 This is the fate of the foolish

15 But God will redeem me from its power

item.title: Psalms 50
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 50

1 God, the Mighty One, the LORD, has spoken

2 He shines forth out of Zion in perfect beauty.

3 Our God comes; he doesn’t stay quiet;

4 He calls on the sky above and the earth beneath

5 Gather my people to me

6 The heavens declare his justice

7 Listen, my people, and I’ll speak;

8 I don’t have any complaint about your sacrifices

9 But I don’t need any bulls from your barns

item.title: Psalms 51
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 51

1 Be gracious to me, God, in proportion to your enduring love;

2 Wash me thoroughly from my sin;

3 I know my failings;

4 I’ve sinned against you and you only;

5 I was born in sin;

6 You want truth in the inward self;

7 Purify me with hyssop, and I’ll be clean;

8 Fill me with joy and happiness again,

9 Don’t look at my sins;

item.title: Psalms 52
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 52

1 God’s enduring love lasts all day;

2 Your tongue cuts like a razor.

3 You like evil more than good,

4 You like words that devour

5 But God will strike you down once and for all;

6 Good people will see it and be amazed;

7 Look at the men that wouldn’t take refuge in God,

8 But I’m like a green olive tree in God’s house;

item.title: Psalms 53
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 53

1 Fools tell themselves there’s no God.

2 God looks down from heaven

3 Every one of them has turned aside and become corrupt;

4 Won’t sinners ever learn?

5 They’ll be in a panic like never before,

6 Oh that deliverance would come out of Zion!

item.title: Psalms 54
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 54

1 Deliver me, God, by your name;

2 Listen to my prayer; hear what I have to say.

3 Foreigners have attacked me;

4 But God helps me; the LORD sustains my life.

5 He pays back my adversaries

6 I’ll sacrifice to him willingly

7 He’s delivered me from all my trouble

item.title: Psalms 55
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 55

1 Hear my prayer, God;

2 Listen and answer;

4 My heart’s pounding;

5 Fear and trembling have come over me;

6 I said, “I wish I had wings like a dove!

7 I’d flee far away

8 I’d hurry to my shelter

9 Lord, destroy their plans; confuse their languages,

10 Day and night they patrol the walls,

11 Ruin is rampant within it;

12 It’s not an enemy that’s disparaging me;

item.title: Psalms 56
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 56

1 Be gracious, God; people are walking all over me,

3 When I’m afraid, I put my trust in you.

4 In you, whose word I praise, I’ve put my trust;

5 All day long they try to frustrate my purposes;

6 They stir up conflict, they lurk, they watch my every step,

7 Because they’re sinful, throw them out;

8 You’ve kept track of my wanderings

item.title: Psalms 57
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 57

1 Be gracious to me, God,

2 I call out to God Most High,

4 I live among lions;

5 Be raised up higher than the sky, God;

6 They’ve set a trap for me to step in;

7 My heart is steadfast, God; it’s steadfast;

8 Wake up, my glory;

9 I’ll give you thanks, God, among the peoples

10 Your enduring love is as high as the sky;

item.title: Psalms 58
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 58

1 Leaders, do you decree what’s right?

2 No, you plot injustice in your hearts

3 The sinful go astray from the womb;

4 They have venom like vipers,

6 Pull out their fangs, God;

7 Make them disappear like water that drains away;

8 Make sinners be like snails that dissolve as they go along,

9 Before your pots can feel the heat of burning briers;

item.title: Psalms 59
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 59

1 Deliver me from my enemies, God;

2 Save me from sinners;

3 They lie in ambush to kill me;

4 For no fault of mine, they run to attack me;

5 LORD God of Hosts, God of Israel,

6 They come back in the evening

7 They growl with their mouth;

8 But you laugh at them, LORD;

9 I’ll watch for you, my Strength, my fortress.

item.title: Psalms 60
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 60

1 You’ve rejected us, God, and broken us;

2 You’ve made the land quake; you’ve split it open;

3 You’ve made your people endure hardship

4 You’ve raised a banner for those who respect you

5 Save us now with your right hand and answer us,

6 In his kindness God has answered;

7 Gilead and Manasseh belong to me;

8 Moab will be my washbasin;

9 Who will take me to a fortified city?

item.title: Psalms 61
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 61

1 Listen to my prayer, God; hear my prayer.

2 With a faint heart I call to you from the end of the earth;

3 You’re my refuge, my strong tower against the enemy.

4 Let me live in your tent forever

5 You’ve heard my vows, God,

6 Lengthen the king’s life;

7 Have him sit enthroned in your presence forever;

8 I’ll sing praise to you forever

item.title: Psalms 62
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 62

1 I wait for God alone

2 He alone is my rock, my salvation, my fortress;

3 How long will youpl assail me

4 Your only intention is to knock me down;

5 My soul, wait in silence for God

6 He alone is my rock, my salvation, my fortress;

7 My deliverance and glory rest with him,

8 Always trust him, people;

9 Common people have no value;

item.title: Psalms 63
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 63

1 God, you’re my God; I look to you in earnest;

2 So I’ve looked at you in the sanctuary

3 I’ll praise you

4 I’ll bless you as long as I live

5 You satisfy my soul like the finest food;

6 I remember you when I’m in bed;

7 You’ve been my help;

8 My soul clings to you;

9 But those who are trying to destroy me

item.title: Psalms 64
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 64

1 Listen to my complaint, God;

2 Hide me from the secret plots of bad people,

5 They latch onto sinful purposes

6 They look for ways to be unjust,

7 But God will wound them with an arrow

9 Then everybody will be respectful

10 Good people will be happy in the LORD

item.title: Psalms 65
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 65

5 You answer us with awesome deeds, God who keeps us safe,

6 You established the mountains by your power

8 They who live at the ends of the earth

9 You take care of the earth and water it;

10 You water the plowed ground abundantly and level its ridges;

11 You crown the year with abundant harvests;

12 The pastures in the countryside drip with dew;

item.title: Psalms 66
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 66

1 Make a joyful sound to God, all the earth.

2 Sing about his honor;

3 Say to him, “What you do is so awesome!

4 All the earth worships you and praises you;

5 Come and see what God has done;

6 He turned the Red Sea into dry ground;

7 He rules by his power forever;

8 Bless our God, you nations;

9 He keeps us alive

item.title: Psalms 67
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 67

1 God, be gracious and bless us;

3 May the nations praise you;

4 May they be happy and sing

5 May the nations praise you, God;

6 The earth has yielded its produce;

item.title: Psalms 68
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 68

1 Arise, God, scatter your enemies;

2 Blow them away like smoke;

3 But may good people be happy,

4 So sing to God, sing praises to him;

5 God in his holy Temple

7 God of Israel, when you went out ahead of your people

9 You sent widespread, abundant rain, God,

10 The animals settled in it;

11 The Lord gives the command,

12 Kings and their armies flee

item.title: Psalms 69
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 69

1 Save me, God;

2 I’ve sunk in deep mud, where there’s no foothold;

3 I’m worn out from crying; my throat’s dry;

4 The people that hate me for no reason

5 God, you know about my foolish choices;

6 May those who put their hope in you

8 I’m alienated from my brothers;

9 I’m consumed with zeal for your Temple;

10 When I humble myself with fasting, they mock me;

item.title: Psalms 70
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 70

1 Hurry and deliver me, LORD;

2 Discredit those who want to kill me;

3 Because of their disgrace,

4 May the ones that depend on you be happy in you;

5 But I’m poor and needy, LORD!

item.title: Psalms 71
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 71

1 I’ve taken refuge in you, LORD;

2 In your goodness, rescue me;

3 Be my rock of refuge that I can always go to;

4 Rescue me from sinners,

5 You’re my hope, Lord GOD,

7 Many have marveled over me

8 I’m full of your praise

9 Don’t set me aside in my old age

10 My enemies speak against me;

11 God has left him.

item.title: Psalms 72
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 72

1 Give the king your judgments, God;

2 May he judge your people fairly,

3 Let the mountains bring prosperity to the people;

4 May he defend the downtrodden,

5 Let them respect you as long as the sun lasts,

6 May the king rule like rain on mown grass,

7 May good people flourish in his time

8 May he rule from sea to sea,

9 Let desert nomads bow to him,

item.title: Psalms 73
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 73

1 God is good to Israel,

2 I’d almost stumbled; my steps almost slipped;

4 They don’t seem to suffer when they die;

5 They don’t have trouble like other people;

6 So pride is the gold chain around their neck;

7 Their eyes are puffy with fatness;

8 They mock, and talk about oppressing,

9 They brag against the sky itself;

10 So his people turn to them

item.title: Psalms 74
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 74

1 Why have you thrown us away forever, God?

2 Remember your community that you bought so long ago,

3 Direct your attention to its continuing ruins;

4 Your adversaries have roared in your sanctuary

5 It’s like someone that used an axe in a forest;

7 They burned the sanctuary to the ground

8 They said to themselves, “We’ll completely subdue them”;

9 We don’t see miraculous signs anymore;

item.title: Psalms 75
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 75

1 Thank you, God, for being close by;

2 When I set a time for judgment;

3 The earth and everybody in it melt;

4 I said to people that brag, ‘Stop it,’

6 Exaltation doesn’t come from the east or west,

8 There’s a cup of foaming wine in his hand;

9 I’ll sing praise to Jacob’s God;

10 He’ll cut off the horns of the wicked,

item.title: Psalms 76
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 76

1 God is known in Judah;

2 His home is in Salem;

3 He has broken flaming arrows there,

4 You’re glorious, more majestic

5 Our stouthearted enemies have been stripped of their spoil;

6 At your rebuke, God of Jacob,

7 You’re to be respected;

8 You rendered judgment from heaven;

10 People’s wrath only heightens your honor;

11 Make your vows to the LORD your God and fulfill them;

item.title: Psalms 77
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 77

1 I raise my voice up to God; I call out loud;

2 When trouble comes, I turn to the LORD for help.

3 When I think about him, I’m shaken;

4 He won’t let me sleep;

5 I think about days gone by, years ago.

6 I remember singing during the night,

7 Will the LORD reject me forever now?

8 Has his enduring love stopped permanently?

item.title: Psalms 78
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 78

1 Listen to my instruction, my people;

2 I’ll tell a parable and offer hidden truths from our history,

4 We won’t keep them from our children;

5 He established a Testimony in Jacob

8 They weren’t to be like their ancestors,

9 The Ephraimites were archers equipped with bows;

10 They didn’t keep God’s covenant

11 They forgot what he’d done,

12 He performed wonders for their ancestors to see

item.title: Psalms 79
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 79

1 Other nations have invaded your inheritance, God;

2 They’ve given the buzzards your servants’ corpses,

3 They’ve poured out their blood like water around Jerusalem;

4 We’ve become a disgrace to our neighbors,

5 LORD, will you be angry forever?

6 Pour out your wrath on nations that don’t know you,

8 Don’t hold our ancestors’ sins against us;

9 For your honor, help us, God who delivers;

item.title: Psalms 80
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 80

1 Listen, Shepherd of Israel,

2 Stir up your power against Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh;

3 Restore us, God;

4 LORD God of Hosts,

5 You’ve fed us tears

6 You made us a taunt to our neighbors;

7 God of Hosts, restore us;

8 You took a grapevine out of Egypt,

9 You cleared the ground for it;

10 It covered the mountains with its shadow

item.title: Psalms 81
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 81

1 Sing to God your Strength;

2 Sing, beat the tambourine,

3 At the new moons blow your ram’s horn,

4 It’s a statute for Israel,

5 He established it as a Testimony in Joseph

6 I’ll take the burden off your shoulders

7 You cried out in trouble, and I rescued you;

8 Listen, my people, when I admonish you;

9 There’s to be no foreign god among you;

item.title: Psalms 82
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 82

1 God presides over the divine council

2 So how long will youpl judge unjustly

3 Renderpl justice to the weak and fatherless;

4 Rescuepl the weak and needy;

5 You don’t know or understand;

6 I say, “You’re gods,

8 You judge the world, God!

item.title: Psalms 83
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 83

1 God, don’t keep quiet; don’t be silent.

2 Your enemies are making an uproar;

3 They’re plotting against your people,

5 Together they’re signing a treaty against you:

6 Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagrites;

7 Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek;

8 Assyria has joined them too;

9 Deal with them like you dealt with Midian,

11 Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb

13 Make them like whirling dust,

item.title: Psalms 84
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 84

1 Your Temple is so beautiful, LORD of Hosts!

2 I long, yes, even faint with longing for your courts;

3 Even a sparrow finds a home for herself,

4 How blessed they are who live in your Temple

5 How blessed people are whose strength comes from you,

6 As they pass through the Valley of Weeping,

7 They grow from strength to more strength

8 LORD God of Hosts, listen to my prayer;

item.title: Psalms 85
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 85

1 LORD, you blessed your land;

4 Restore us, our Deliverer;

5 Will you be angry with us forever?

6 Won’t you revive us

7 Show us your enduring love, LORD;

8 I’ll listen to what our God the LORD says,

9 His salvation is nearby for those who respect him,

10 Truth and enduring love combine;

11 Faithfulness grows up from the ground,

12 The LORD gives what’s good

item.title: Psalms 86
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 86

1 Listen, LORD, and answer me

2 Preserve my life because I’m a godly man;

3 Be gracious to me

4 Make me happy

5 You’re good, ready to forgive,

6 Hear my prayer, LORD;

7 When I’m in trouble, I call on you

8 There’s no one like you among the gods,

9 All the nations you’ve made will come

11 Teach me your way;

12 I’ll thank you, LORD my God, with all my heart

item.title: Psalms 87
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 87

1 The city that the LORD founded stands on his holy mountain;

3 Glorious things are said about you, city of God.

4 I’ll count Rahab [Egypt] and Babylon among those who know me,

5 But they will say about Zion,

6 When the LORD registers the nations,

7 Then those who sing and those who play flutes will say,

item.title: Psalms 88
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 88

1 LORD God who keeps me safe,

2 Let my prayer come to you;

3 I’ve had so much trouble;

4 I’m as good as dead,

5 Abandoned among the dead

6 You’ve put me in the Pit,

7 Your anger overwhelms me;

8 You’ve made my friends avoid me

9 My sight is blurry from tears;

10 Do you perform wonders for the dead?

11 Do they declare your enduring love in the grave

item.title: Psalms 89
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 89

1 I’ll sing forever about the LORD’s enduring love

3 The LORD said, “I’ve made a covenant with my chosen one;

5 The sky praises your wonders

6 Who in the sky can compare with you?

8 Lord GOD of Hosts, who is like you?

9 You rule the raging sea;

10 You’ve crushed Rahab like one that’s slain

11 The sky is yours; the earth belongs to you;

item.title: Psalms 90
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 90

1 LORD, through all generations

2 Before the mountains were born

3 You turn people back to dust and say,

4 A thousand years to you

5 You sweep us away like the dreams in our sleep.

7 Your anger consumes us;

8 You place our iniquities in front of you;

9 All our days pass away in your fury;

10 We live for 70 years or by good health for 80 years;

item.title: Psalms 91
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 91

1 Those who live in the shelter of the Most High

2 They’ll say about the LORD,

3 He delivers you from the trapper’s snare

4 He covers you with his pinions;

5 You won’t be afraid of terrors at night,

7 A thousand may fall at your side,

8 You’ll stand by and watch his recompense to the wicked,

10 Misfortune won’t fall on you;

11 He’ll make his angels responsible

item.title: Psalms 92
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 92

1 It’s good to thank you, LORD,

4 Because you’ve made me happy by what you’ve done,

5 Your deeds are so great, LORD,

6 Senseless people don’t realize,

8 But you’re on high forever.

9 Your enemies will perish;

10 You’ve made me as strong as a wild ox

11 I’ve looked in triumph at my enemies

12 Good people flourish like palm trees;

13 Planted in the LORD’s Temple,

item.title: Psalms 93
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 93

1 The LORD reigns, robed in majesty,

2 Your throne has been secure from of old;

3 The floods have swelled;

4 But more than the thunder of overwhelming water,

5 Your decrees stand firm;

item.title: Psalms 94
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 94

1 LORD God of vengeance, shine!

2 Rise up, Judge of the whole world;

3 How long will you let sinners celebrate?

4 How long will they pour out their arrogant words,

8 You silly people, you pay attention;

9 Can’t he hear, who created the ear?

10 Won’t he that rebukes nations, discipline you;

11 The LORD knows that your thoughts

12 The ones you discipline are blessed, LORD,

item.title: Psalms 95
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 95

1 Come, let’s sing to the LORD;

2 Let’s go to him with thanksgiving

3 The LORD is a great God,

4 He controls the deep sea;

6 Come, let’s bow in worship;

7 He’s our God, and we’re sheep in his pasture,

9 Your ancestors kept testing me

10 I detested that generation and said,

11 So I swore in my anger,

item.title: Psalms 96
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 96

1 Sing a new song to the LORD;

2 Bless him in song;

3 Tell about his glory the world over,

4 The LORD is great and deserves great praise;

6 Honor and majesty lie in him;

7 Families of the nations,

8 Attribute to the LORD the glory he deserves;

9 Worship him in holy attire;

10 Say among the nations, “The LORD reigns;

11 Let the heavens be happy and the earth rejoice;

item.title: Psalms 97
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 97

1 The LORD reigns; let the world rejoice;

2 Clouds and dense darkness surround him;

3 Fire goes forth ahead of him

4 His lightning lights up the world;

5 The mountains melt like wax

6 The sky declares his goodness;

7 Let those who worship carved images be discredited,

8 Zion hears that and is happy;

9 You’re greater than all gods.

10 Hate evil, you that love the LORD,

item.title: Psalms 98
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 98

1 Sing a new song to the LORD

2 He has made his salvation known

3 He has remembered his enduring love

4 Make a joyful sound to the LORD, all the earth;

5 Sing praises to him with lyre and melody;

7 Let the ocean roar and everything in it,

8 Let the rivers clap their hands;

item.title: Psalms 99
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 99

1 The LORD reigns;

2 The LORD is great in Zion;

3 Let them praise his great, awesome name;

4 The great King who loves justice

5 Exalt the LORD our God

6 Moses and Aaron were among his priests;

7 He spoke to them in the pillar of cloud;

8 He was a forgiving God;

9 Exalt the LORD our God

item.title: Psalms 100
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 100

1 Make a joyful sound to the LORD, all the earth.

2 Serve him gladly;

3 Acknowledge that the LORD is God;

4 Enter his gates with thanksgiving

item.title: Psalms 101
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 101

1 I’ll sing about your enduring love and justice,

2 I’ll pay attention to the way that’s blameless;

3 I won’t set anything base beside me;

4 I’ll cast perverse things out of my heart

5 I’ll withdraw from anyone that slanders another;

6 I’ll focus my attention on the faithful

7 I won’t let deceivers serve in my Temple;

8 Each morning I’ll destroy the wicked in the land

item.title: Psalms 102
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 102

1 Listen to my prayer, LORD!

2 Don’t turn away from me in my distress;

3 My days dissipate like smoke;

4 My heart is weak and withers away like grass;

6 I’m like a pelican in the desert,

7 I lie awake

8 My enemies taunt me all day;

9 I eat ashes for food

11 My days are like a shadow;

12 But you live forever, LORD;

item.title: Psalms 103
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 103

1 Bless the LORD, all that I am!

2 Bless the LORD, all that I am;

6 The LORD performs good deeds

7 He made his ways known to Moses

8 The LORD is merciful and gracious,

9 He won’t constantly confront us

10 He hasn’t dealt with us according to our sins

11 As high as the sky is above the earth,

12 As far as the east is from the west,

item.title: Psalms 104
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 104

1 Bless the LORD, everything that I am!

2 You cover yourself with light as with a robe;

3 You laid the beams for your rooms on the water;

4 You make the winds your messengers

5 You built the earth on foundations

6 You covered it with the ocean like a robe

7 At your rebuke it receded;

8 The mountains rose up; the valleys sank down

item.title: Psalms 105
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 105

1 Be grateful to the LORD; call on him;

2 Sing praises to him;

3 Take pride in his holy name;

4 Rely on the LORD and his strength;

5 Remember his amazing miracles,

7 He’s the LORD our God,

8 He remembers his eternal covenant,

11 He swore, “I’ll give you Canaan to inherit.”

12 When they were just a few,

14 He didn’t let anybody oppress them;

item.title: Psalms 106
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 106

1 Hallelujah!

2 Who can recount all his mighty deeds?

3 How blessed they are who maintain justice,

4 Remember me, LORD, when you’re gracious to your people;

6 We and our ancestors have sinned,

7 Our ancestors in Egypt didn’t get the point of the LORD’s amazing acts

8 Nevertheless, he saved them to defend his honor

9 He commanded the Red Sea to dry up,

item.title: Psalms 107
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 107

1 Be grateful to the LORD because he’s good;

2 Let his redeemed say it,

4 Some wandered in trackless desert

5 Hungry and thirsty,

6 Then they appealed to the LORD in their trouble,

8 They need to thank him for his enduring love

9 He satisfies the thirsty

10 Some sat in darkness and death’s shadow,

12 So he humbled them with labor;

13 Then they appealed to the LORD in their trouble,

item.title: Psalms 108
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 108

1 I’m steadfast, God;

2 Wake up, harp and lyre;

3 I’ll thank you, LORD, among the nations

5 Be lifted up, God, above the sky;

6 Save with your power and answer me

7 God has spoken in his holiness:

8 Gilead and Manasseh belong to me;

9 Moab, my washbasin;

10 Who will take me to the besieged city?

11 Are you rejecting us, God?

item.title: Psalms 109
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 109

1 God that I praise, speak up for me!

2 Deceitful people speak against me;

3 They surround me with hateful words

4 In return for my love, they accuse me

5 They repay me evil for good,

6 Appoint someone corrupt over them,

7 When they’re judged, pronounce them guilty;

8 Shorten their lives

9 Make their children fatherless

10 Have their children go begging,

11 Have their creditors seize everything they own

item.title: Psalms 110
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 110

1 The LORD said to my Lord,

2 The LORD will extend your mighty scepter from on Zion,

3 Your soldiers will volunteer readily

4 The LORD has sworn and won’t change his mind,

5 The LORD is at your right hand

6 He’ll render judgment against the nations by filling them with corpses;

7 He’ll refresh himself from streams along the way

item.title: Psalms 111
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 111

1 Hallelujah!

2 His works are so outstanding

5 He feeds those who respect him

7 His works are just and true;

9 He has provided redemption for his people

10 Respecting the LORD is the most important thing about being wise;

item.title: Psalms 112
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 112

1 Hallelujah!

2 Their descendants will be successful

3 They’ll have wealth and riches in their homes,

4 Godly people have light in the dark;

5 Goodness comes to those who graciously lend

6 Misfortune won’t overcome them,

7 Bad news doesn’t scare people like that

9 They give freely to the poor,

10 Sinners will see that and get mad;

item.title: Psalms 113
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 113

1 Hallelujah!

4 On high above the nations,

5 Who is like the LORD our God

7 Then he raises up the poor from the dust

9 He gives the barren woman a home

item.title: Psalms 114
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 114

1 When Israel left Egypt—

3 The Red Sea saw them coming and backed away;

4 The mountains jumped like rams;

5 What’s the matter with you, Sea, that you’re backing away,

7 Earth, tremble at the Lord, Jacob’s God,

item.title: Psalms 115
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 115

1 Not to us, LORD, not to us,

2 Why should the nations say,

3 Our God is in heaven,

4 Their man-made idols are just silver and gold

8 The ones that make them will become like them,

9 Israel, trust in the LORD;

10 House of Aaron, trust in the LORD;

11 All of you that respect the LORD, trust in him;

12 He cares about you; he’ll bless you;

item.title: Psalms 116
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 116

1 I love the LORD because he listens to my petitions;

3 The snares of death were all around me;

4 Then I called on the LORD,

5 You’re gracious and good, merciful God.

6 You preserve the simple;

7 I can rest again

9 I’ll walk with you in the land of the living.

10 I kept believing even when I said,

11 I said in my anxiety,

item.title: Psalms 117
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 117

1 Praise the LORD, every nation;

item.title: Psalms 118
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 118

1 Be grateful to the LORD because he’s good;

2 Let Israel say,

3 Let the house of Aaron say,

4 Let those who respect the LORD say,

5 I called on the LORD in my distress,

6 He’s on my side; so I won’t be afraid;

7 He’s beside me to help me;

8 It’s better to take refuge in the LORD than trust in people,

item.title: Psalms 119
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 119

1 How blessed they are who follow his way blamelessly,

3 They do no evil who follow his ways.

4 You’ve charged us

5 Oh that my ways may become secure

6 I won’t be disgraced

7 I’ll thank you by living with a godly heart

8 I’ll keep your statutes;

9 How can the young keep their conduct pure?

10 I’ve looked to you wholeheartedly;

11 I’ve treasured up your word in my heart

item.title: Psalms 120
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 120

1 In my troubles I appealed to the LORD,

2 LORD, rescue me from lying lips

3 What will God do to you, treacherous tongues?

4 He’ll pierce you with a soldier’s sharp arrows

5 Misfortune awaits me because I’m a foreigner in Meshech,

6 For too long I’ve lived where people hate peace.

7 I’m for peace; but when I speak up, they’re for war. Ps 120:1-7

item.title: Psalms 121
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 121

1 I look up toward the mountains—

2 It’ll come from the LORD,

3 He won’t let your foot slip.

5 The LORD is your keeper;

6 The sun won’t harm you during the day

7 The LORD will protect you from harm

8 He’ll guard you in everything you do

item.title: Psalms 122
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 122

1 It made me happy when they said,

2 We’re standing inside your gates, Jerusalem,

6 Pray for peace in Jerusalem:

8 For the sake of my brothers and friends,

9 For the sake of the Temple of the LORD our God,

item.title: Psalms 123
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 123

1 I look to you enthroned in heaven!

2 Like a servant looks to his master

3 Be gracious to us, LORD,

4 For too long our lives have been full of

item.title: Psalms 124
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 124

1 Let Israel acknowledge,

6 Bless the LORD,

7 We escaped like a bird from a trapper’s snare;

8 Our help comes from the LORD,

item.title: Psalms 125
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 125

1 Those who trust in the LORD are like Mount Zion,

2 Like mountains surround Jerusalem,

3 Sinners won’t rule

4 The LORD does good to those who do good,

5 But those who turn aside to their crooked ways,

item.title: Psalms 126
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 126

1 When the LORD brought us exiles back to Zion,

2 Our mouths were laughing,

3 Yes, the LORD has done great things for us;

4 Restore our fortunes, LORD,

5 Those who sow in tears will reap with joy.

6 Those who go back and forth weeping with their bags of seed,

item.title: Psalms 127
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 127

1 Unless the LORD builds the house,

2 In vain you rise early and work late

3 Children are a gift from the LORD;

4 Children born to a young man are

5 How blessed he is that has a quiver full of them;

item.title: Psalms 128
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 128

1 How blessed you are that respect the LORD

2 When you eat what you earn,

3 Your wife will be like a fruitful vine in your house;

4 That’s how you’re blessed who respect the LORD.

5 The LORD bless you from Zion;

6 May you live to see your grandchildren.

item.title: Psalms 129
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 129

1 Let Israel say,

2 They’ve persecuted me often since I was young,

3 My back looks like a farmer plowed it

4 The LORD is good;

5 May everyone that hates Zion

6 Let them be like grass on a rooftop

7 The reaper doesn’t fill his hand with it,

8 People that go past don’t say,

item.title: Psalms 130
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 130

1 LORD, I’ve cried out to you from the depths;

3 If you kept track of sins, who could stand?

4 But you forgive so people can continue to respect you.

5 I wait for the LORD

6 I wait for the Lord

7 Israel, put your hope in the LORD

8 He’ll redeem Israel from its sins. Ps 130:1-8

item.title: Psalms 131
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 131

1 LORD, my heart’s not proud or my eyes arrogant;

2 I’ve calmed and quieted myself;

3 Israel, put your hope in the LORD

item.title: Psalms 132
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 132

1 LORD, remember David and what he suffered;

3 I won’t go to my own house

6 We heard it in Ephrathah

7 Let’s go to his Temple

8 Come to your resting place, LORD,

9 May your priests be arrayed in goodness,

10 For the sake of David your servant,

11 You’ve sworn to him

12 If your descendants keep my covenant

13 You’ve chosen Zion;

item.title: Psalms 133
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 133

1 It’s so good and pleasant

2 It’s like precious anointing oil

3 It’s like the dew from Mount Hermon

item.title: Psalms 134
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 134

1 Bless the LORD, you servants of the LORD

2 Raise your hands toward the sanctuary

3 May the One that made earth and sky

item.title: Psalms 135
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 135

1 Hallelujah!

3 Praise him because he’s good;

5 I know the LORD is great,

6 He does what he wants

7 He makes clouds come up from the horizon;

8 He struck Egypt’s firstborn,

9 He performed signs and wonders

10 He struck many nations

11 Sihon, king of the Amorites;

12 He gave their land as an inheritance

13 His name lasts forever;

14 The LORD will vindicate his people

item.title: Psalms 136
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 136

1 Give thanks to the LORD because he’s good.

2 Give thanks to the God of gods.

3 Give thanks to the Lord of lords,

19 Sihon, king of the Amorites,

26 Thank God in heaven.

item.title: Psalms 137
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 137

1 We sat by the rivers in Babylon

2 We hung our harps on its willows.

3 Our captors required us to sing there;

4 How can we sing about the LORD in a foreign land?

5 If I forget you, Jerusalem,

6 May my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth

7 Remember, LORD, against the Edomites

8 Young woman of Babylon, you devastated one,

item.title: Psalms 138
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 138

1 I thank you with all my heart

2 I bow toward your holy Temple

3 You answered me when I called out to you

4 Kings will thank you, LORD,

5 They’ll sing about your ways

6 Though you’re high above us,

7 Though I’m in trouble, you’ll protect me

8 You’ll accomplish the purposes you have for me;

item.title: Psalms 139
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 139

1 LORD, you’ve known me and examined me.

2 You know when I sit down and when I get up;

3 You search out my traveling and my resting;

4 Before I speak,

5 You’ve protected me front and back

6 Knowledge like that is too amazing for me;

7 Where can I go from your Spirit?

8 If I go up to the sky, you’re there;

item.title: Psalms 140
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 140

1 LORD, rescue me from sinful people

3 They have pointed tongues like a snake;

4 LORD, protect me from sinful people;

5 The arrogant hide traps for me;

6 I said to the LORD, “You’re my God;

7 GOD the Lord, my strong deliverer,

8 Don’t let sinful people do whatever they please;

9 Make the schemes they talk about

10 Let burning coals fall on them;

item.title: Psalms 141
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 141

1 LORD, I’m calling on you; come quick;

2 Consider my prayer as incense

3 Guard my mouth;

4 Incline my heart away from anything evil,

5 Let a godly person strike me or rebuke me graciously;

6 When their leaders are thrown over the cliffs;

7 Like someone plowing up rocks,

8 I look to you, Lord GOD,

9 Keep me from the jaws of the trap they’ve set for me,

item.title: Psalms 142
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 142

1 I cry out to the LORD

2 I pour out my complaint to him

3 When I feel overwhelmed,

4 I look in every direction,

5 I’m calling out to you, LORD;

6 Listen to my outcry

7 Bring me out of prison

item.title: Psalms 143
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 143

1 Hear my prayer, LORD;

2 Don’t put me on trial

3 My enemy has chased me,

4 So I feel overwhelmed,

5 I remember the old days;

6 I reach out for you,

7 Answer me right away, LORD;

8 Let me hear about your enduring love every morning

9 Deliver me from my enemies;

10 Teach me how to do your will

11 In defense of your honor, LORD, protect me;

item.title: Psalms 144
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 144

1 Bless the LORD, my Rock,

2 He’s my enduring love and fortress,

3 LORD, what are we that you give us any thought

4 We’re like a breath;

5 Lower the sky, LORD, and come down;

6 Throw your lightning bolts and scatter my enemies;

7 Reach down from on high

9 I’ll sing you a new song, God;

10 You deliver kings

11 Deliver me from aliens that lie,

item.title: Psalms 145
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 145

1 I’ll praise you highly, my God and king,

2 I’ll bless you every day

3 You’re great and deserve great praise;

4 One generation will praise your works to the next

5 They’ll think about your majestic glory and splendor

6 People will talk about the power evident in your awesome deeds

7 They’ll overflow with the fame of your abundant goodness

8 The LORD is gracious and merciful,

item.title: Psalms 146
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 146

1 Praise the LORD, my soul!

2 I’ll praise my God as long as I live

3 Don’t rely on rulers,

4 They quit breathing and go back into the ground;

5 How blessed they are that have Jacob’s God to help them,

8 He gives sight to the blind,

9 He protects foreigners

10 The LORD will reign forever,

item.title: Psalms 147
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 147

1 Hallelujah!

2 The LORD builds up Jerusalem

3 He heals the brokenhearted

4 He counts the stars

5 Our Lord is great and has great power,

6 He supports the abused

7 Sing thanksgiving to the LORD;

8 He covers the sky with clouds,

9 He gives animals their food

10 He doesn’t delight in the strength of horses

11 The LORD favors those who respect him,

item.title: Psalms 148
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 148

1 Hallelujah!

2 Praise him, all his hosts of angels.

3 Praise him, sun and moon

4 Praise him, highest heaven,

5 Let them praise the LORD

6 He established them forever

7 Praise the LORD from earth,

13 Praise the LORD

14 He makes his people strong

item.title: Psalms 149
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 149

1 Hallelujah!

2 Be happy in your Maker, Israel;

3 Praise him with dancing;

5 Holy people, celebrate in glory;

6 Have the high praises of God in your voices

10 Hallelujah! Ps 149:5-10

item.title: Psalms 150
item.description:
Psalms Chapter 150

1 Hallelujah!

2 Praise him for his powerful deeds

3 Praise him with trumpet, harp, and lyre.

4 Praise him with tambourines and dancing,

5 Praise him with cymbals,

6 Everything that breathes, praise the LORD.
